body: What is the reason behind this? If a post is made public (= posted in a public guild), why should it be omitted from search results? The search functionality is pretty limited on its own (no search in guild, or links to domain, or by user, or in a specific time/date range), but because it also ignores private accounts, it's quite useless and I usually end up using generic search engine, or post and learn it was already posted (but not found via search) or just give up and don't post at all.
body_html: What is the reason behind this? If a post is made public (= posted in a public guild), why should it be omitted from search results? The search functionality is pretty limited on its own (no search in guild, or links to domain, or by user, or in a specific time/date range), but because it also ignores private accounts, it's quite useless and I usually end up using generic search engine, or post and learn it was already posted (but not found via search) or just give up and don't post at all.
title: Why search ignores posts from private accounts?

body: A while back someone pointed out that indexing posts from private accounts rendered the privacy option essentially useless, since you could just search the user name and get the user's post history. Probably something to do with that, I'd guess.
body_html: A while back someone pointed out that indexing posts from private accounts rendered the privacy option essentially useless, since you could just search the user name and get the user's post history. Probably something to do with that, I'd guess.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

body: He's talking about search results on ruqqus itself, not search results on general search engines.
